concept.title: Troubleshoot from the Alarm Panel

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains how to use the Alarm Panel on the Bruce UPS system to diagnose faults, review alarm details, acknowledge alerts, and take corrective actions.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: alarm panel; alarm codes; fault indicators; system warnings; event logs; module alarms; system statuses

othermeta.name: tags
othermeta.content: alarm panel,alarm codes,fault diagnosis,UPs troubleshooting,alerts,system warnings

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: Guide technicians in diagnosing and resolving system alarms using the Bruce UPS Alarm Panel

conbody.note: The alarm text is only displayed in English even if another system language is used.

entry.p: The DC is below the low DC warning/shutdown level
The DC power input is out of tolerance or unavailable.
The DC is above the high DC warning/shutdown level
The DC is below the low DC warning level
Switch open or auxiliary contact not connected
The inverter power unit temperature is too high
The load current is higher than the nominal current of the system
Inverter input switch Q020 is open
The bypass mains frequency is out of tolerance or unstable
The bypass mains voltage or the frequency is out of tolerance
Wiring at the bypass mains input terminal
Manual bypass switch Q050 is not at position Auto
The bypass mains voltage or the frequency is out of tolerance
The static switch EN temperature is too high
The static switch EA temperature is too high
111-114: Static switches temperature warning or shutdown
116-139: Power module temperature warning or shutdown
The winding material is too hot
The heat-sink of the power components is too hot
6: PSU AC or DC not working
7: AC power supply for parallel inverter fault
8: DC power supply for parallel inverter fault
Power supply units : PSU A201 / A202
AC or DC power supply sources
96: At least one parallel cable interrupted
At least one of the parallel cables are inoperable or disconnected
The ISBS cannot switch to bypass because it could not switch on the static switch EN.
Check the bypass mains power supply and connection.
The load output switch Q200 is open.
The system output is disconnected from the inverter.
The load is no longer supplied.
Surge protection fuse blown or tripped.
The input voltage (average) is out of tolerance
The input frequency is out of tolerance
At least one phase is not connected
Wiring at the rectifier mains input terminal
